title: Ordinals trader gets Bitcoin back after fat-fingered NFT purchase
description:
The seller saw the buyer’s X post and decided to buy back the Bitcoin Ordinals NFT for the same amount of Bitcoin.

A Bitcoin Ordinals trader managed to recover their money after making an error purchase of a $13,000 nonfungible token (NFT) on the Bitcoin (BTC) network. 

On March 1, a Bitcoin Ordinals trader shared a post on X about how they made their “biggest mistake” since they started trading Bitcoin-based NFTs. The trader thought they bought an NFT for 0.021 BTC, worth about $1,287. However, the surprise came after the transaction when the trader realized that the NFT was listed at 0.21 BTC (about $12,877).

The trader said they felt embarrassed and sick and that a “lucky person” received a lot of money. According to the NFT trader, they shared the incident to urge others to double-check their digital asset transactions before going through with them.

Read more

title: Blast network TVL plummets 65% losing $2 billion in 24 hours post-mainnet launch
description:
Crypto investors have swiftly removed their assets on the Ethereum-based layer two blockchain Blast following its Feb. 29 mainnet launch. According to DefiLama and Flipside data, the total value of assets locked (TVL) on the network plummeted by over 65% in the past day, dropping to $745.47 million from a peak of $2.27 billion. Last […]

title: Prominent Tech News Outlet Faces Backlash Over Use of AI-Generated Articles
description: CNET, a prominent tech news outlet, has come under fire for using generative AI in finance-related articles. The revelation, brought to light by Futurism, sparked widespread controversy due to numerous errors and instances of plagiarism found within the AI-generated content. The fallout has led to significant repercussions, including a downgrade in CNET’s reliability rating on […]
